summary: Strong applicant with excellent credit profile
decision_rationale: Applicant demonstrates strong credit profile with excellent income stability, healthy reserves, and favorable LTV ratio. Credit score in good range. All standard underwriting criteria met.
underwriter_notes: Standard approval. No compensating factors needed. Recommend competitive rate.

summary: Good applicant with elevated DTI requiring additional documentation
decision_rationale: Applicant has good credit score and stable employment. DTI slightly elevated at 41.2% but within QM guidelines. High LTV requires PMI. Reserves adequate but not strong.
conditions: Verification of 2 additional months of bank statements
Employment verification within 10 days of closing
underwriter_notes: Approved with conditions. Compensating factors: stable healthcare industry employment, no derogatory credit history. Rate adjustment of +0.25% recommended.

summary: Self-employed applicant with strong assets but complex income
decision_rationale: Self-employed status requires additional scrutiny. However, applicant demonstrates excellent credit score, strong reserves (14+ months), and favorable LTV. Six years of consistent self-employment income documented.
conditions: Two years of complete tax returns required
underwriter_notes: Escalated to senior underwriter due to self-employment. Approved based on strong compensating factors. Substantial reserves offset self-employment risk.

summary: Applicant with poor credit and insufficient reserves
decision_rationale: Multiple critical risk factors present: credit score below minimum threshold (562 < 580), DTI exceeds 43% limit (48.5%), LTV exceeds conventional maximum (96.8%), insufficient reserves (1.2 months). No compensating factors available.
underwriter_notes: Application denied. Recommended applicant work on improving credit score, reducing debt, and building savings. May be eligible for FHA loan program in future.

summary: First-time homebuyer with strong credit and family gift for down payment
decision_rationale: First-time homebuyer with strong credit profile. LTV slightly elevated but within PMI guidelines. Gift funds properly documented. Stable employment in finance sector.
underwriter_notes: Approved with standard conditions. Strong candidate for first-time buyer program. Gift funds sourced and documented properly.

decision_rationale: Despite favorable LTV and reserves, applicant has Chapter 7 bankruptcy discharged only 2 years ago. Conventional loans require minimum 4-year waiting period post-bankruptcy. Credit score still recovering.
underwriter_notes: Denied due to bankruptcy waiting period requirement. Applicant may reapply after 4-year waiting period from discharge date. Consider FHA program which has 2-year waiting period.
